etymology.description: 𦎫 (phonetic) + 丮 (semantic, now corrupted to 丸) -> phonetic 享 + 丸 -> 孰
etymology.interpretation: The character 孰 is a phono-semantic compound where 𦎫 provides the phonetic element and 丮 provides the semantic element. Over time, the original components have become corrupted into 享 and 丸, combining to form the modern character 孰 which relates to the meanings of being cooked or ripe.
